explanation: The program used the floating-point division operator '/' when an integer division was intended. Competitive programming tasks and counting calculations generally require integer division (//) to produce an integer result. I fixed the last print to use '//' so the output is an integer.
fixed_code:
inp=input().split()
A=inp[0]
A=int(A)
B=inp[1]
B=int(B)
C=inp[2]
C=int(C)
X=inp[3]
X=int(X)
D=B-A
if A>=X:
    print(1)
elif B<X:
    print(0)
else:    
    print(D//C)
